snippet: Thousands demonstrated again on Tuesday in Dhaka, fueled by anger over a recent ruling by the country’s special war crimes tribunal that they say was too lenient.
abstract: Protests erupt across Dhaka, Bangladesh, fueled by anger over government's sentencing of war criminal Abdul Quader Molla to life in prison, ruling that many people believe is far too lenient.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: Thousands demonstrated again on Tuesday in Dhaka, fueled by anger over a recent ruling by the country’s special war crimes tribunal that they say was too lenient.

headline.seo: Politics in Bangladesh Jolted by Huge Protests
headline.main: Politics in Bangladesh Jolted by Daily Demonstrations
headline.print_headline: Politics in Bangladesh Jolted by Daily Demonstrations

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
